SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.ianywhere.ultralitejni12
Class DatabaseManager

java.lang.Object
  com.ianywhere.ultralitejni12.DatabaseManager

public class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object

Provides static methods to obtain basic configurations, create a new database, and connect to an existing database.

The following example demonstrates how to open an existing database, and create a new one if it does not exist. 

 // J2SE Sample
 Connection conn;
 ConfigFile config = DatabaseManager.createConfigurationFile(
         "test.ulj"
     );
 try {
     conn = DatabaseManager.connect(config);
 } catch(ULjException ex) {
     conn = DatabaseManager.createDatabase(config);
     // Create the schema here.
 }
 

 // BlackBerry Sample
 Connection conn;
 ConfigObjectStore config = DatabaseManager.createConfigurationObjectStore(
         "test.ulj"
     );
 try {
     conn = DatabaseManager.connect(config);
 } catch(ULjException ex) {
     conn = DatabaseManager.createDatabase(config);
     // Create the schema here.
 }
 

 // BlackBerry media card Sample
 Connection conn;
 ConfigFileME config = DatabaseManager.createConfigurationFileME(
         "file:///SDCard/ulj/test.ulj"
     );
 try {
     conn = DatabaseManager.connect(config);
 } catch(ULjException ex) {
     conn = DatabaseManager.createDatabase(config);
     // Create the schema here.
 }
 

 // Android Sample
 Connection conn;
 ConfigFileAndroid config = DatabaseManager.createConfigurationFileAndroid(
         "test.udb",
         getApplicationContext());
 try {
     conn = DatabaseManager.connect(config);
 } catch(ULjException ex) {
     conn = DatabaseManager.createDatabase(config);
     // Create the schema here.
 }

See Also:
Connection

Method Detail

createDatabase

public static Connection createDatabase(Configuration config)
                                 throws ULjException
Creates a new database based on a Configuration and returns the Connection.

This method replaces any database with same name.

Parameters:
config - The Configuration for the new database.
Returns:
A Connection to the new database.
Throws:
ULjException
See Also:
Configuration

createConfigurationFileAndroid

public static ConfigFileAndroid createConfigurationFileAndroid(java.lang.String file_name,
                                                               android.content.Context context)
                                                        throws ULjException
Creates a Configuration with an Android file as the physical store and returns a ConfigFileAndroid. Note: You must use this method, supplying a non-null context, if either of the following are true: (a) the file_name is not an absolute path to the database file, or (b) data synchronization with https protocol is used in the application.

Parameters:
file_name - The name of file to use or create.
context - Context object from an Android application
Returns:
The ConfigFileAndroid used to configure a database.
Throws:
ULjException
See Also:
ConfigFileAndroid

release

public static void release()
                    throws ULjException
Closes the DatabaseManager to release all connections and to shutdown all databases. On Android, this method releases all resources, and must be called only once by a single thread when the application is finished with the DatabaseManager and objects that were created by it.

Any uncommitted transactions are rolled back.

Throws:
ULjException

setErrorLanguage

public static void setErrorLanguage(java.lang.String lang)
Sets the language to use for error messages.

Recognized languages are EN, DE, FR, JA, ZH. If an unrecognized language is specified, the system reverts to the default.

In J2SE and BlackBerry J2ME environments, the current Locale is used to determine the default language. In other J2ME environments, this method provides the only way to specify the language. The default language is "EN".

Parameters:
lang - The language code as a double character.
